CFSBCACTIVITY.title: Chicago Fed Survey of Business Conditions: Activity Index in Federal Reserve District 7: Chicago
CFSBCACTIVITY.notes:
What is the Survey of Business Conditions?
Business contacts in the Seventh Federal Reserve District are asked to rate how various business indicators changed from a month ago along a seven-point scale ranging from "large increase" to "large decrease." A series of diffusion indexes summarizing the distribution of responses is then calculated.

How are the indexes constructed?
Respondents' answers on the seven-point scale are assigned a numeric value ranging from +3 to –3. Each diffusion index is calculated as the difference between the number of respondents with answers above their respective average responses and the number of respondents with answers below their respective average responses, divided by the total number of respondents. The index is then multiplied by 100 so that it ranges from +100 to −100 and will be +100 if every respondent provides an above-average answer and –100 if every respondent provides a below average answer. Respondents with no prior history of responses are excluded from the calculation.

What do the numbers mean?
Respondents' respective average answers to a question can be interpreted as representing their historical trends, or long-run averages. Thus, zero index values indicate that, on balance, activity, hiring, capital spending, and cost pressures are growing at their trend rates or that outlooks are neutral. Positive index values indicate above-average growth (or optimistic outlooks) on balance, and negative values indicate below-average growth (or pessimistic outlooks) on balance.

Beginning with the May 12, 2020, release, the CFSBC moved to a monthly release schedule. This release, with data for April 2020, now contains estimated monthly historical values for the CFSBC indexes, as will all future releases. For additional information on how the survey and indexes changed, see the CFSBC FAQs available here (https://www.chicagofed.org/publications/cfsbc/index).

CFSBCNWAGECOSTS.title: Chicago Fed Survey of Business Conditions: Nonwage Costs Index in Federal Reserve District 7: Chicago (DISCONTINUED)
CFSBCNWAGECOSTS.notes:
February data are collected from January to Early February and are associated with March Beige Book issue.
March data are collected from Late February to March and are associated with April Beige Book issue.
May data are collected from April to early May and are associated with June Beige Book issue.
June data are collected from late May to June and are associated with July Beige Book issue.
August data are collected July to early August and are associated with September Beige Book issue.
September data are collected from late August to September and are associated with October Beige Book issue.
November data are collected from October to early November and are associated with late November or December Beige Book issue.
December data are collected from late November to December and are associated with January Beige Book issue.

To support its Beige Book efforts, the Chicago Fed gathers information from its business contacts using an online survey system. Respondents are asked to rate various aspects of business conditions along a seven-point scale ranging from “substantially increased” to “substantially decreased.” A series of diffusion indexes summarizing the distribution of responses is then calculated. Respondents’ respective average answers to a question can be interpreted as representing their historical trends or long-run averages. Thus, zero index values indicate that, on balance, activity, hiring, capital spending, or cost pressures are growing at their trend rates or that outlooks are neutral. Positive index values indicate above-average growth (or optimistic outlooks) on balance, and negative values indicate below average growth (or pessimistic outlooks) on balance.
For more information, see https://www.chicagofed.org/publications/cfsbc/index

For additional information on how the survey and indexes changed, see the CFSBC FAQs available here (https://www.chicagofed.org/publications/cfsbc/index).

HCOMPBS.title: Business Sector: Hourly Compensation for All Employed Persons
HCOMPBS.notes:
The Productivity and Costs release on August 7, 2003,
will reflect the June 2003 benchmark revision to payroll
employment. Since employment is now reported on
a North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) basis,
all of the historical data will be revised.
Changes as a consequence of the move to
NAICS should not be significant since this release
carries data at high levels of aggregation.

HOABS.title: Business Sector: Hours Worked for All Employed Persons

IPDBS.title: Business Sector: Implicit Price Deflator for All Employed Persons

MFPPBS.title: Private Business Sector: Multifactor Productivity
MFPPBS.notes:
Source Code: MPU4900012

Real Value-Added Output divided by combined inputs.

This data is constructed by the source by linking SIC 1948 from 1987 data with the NAICS data from 1987 from present.

Complete information of the methods and data underlying these measures can be found in "Technical Information About the BLS Multifactor Productivity Measures" (https://www.bls.gov/mfp/mprtech.pdf) and "BLS Handbook of Methods, Chapter 11 Industry Productivity Measures" (http://www.bls.gov/opub/hom/pdf/homch11.pdf).

Information is also available on the Multifactor Productivity Website at http://www.bls.gov/mfp .

MPU4900013.title: Private Business Sector: Multifactor Productivity
MPU4900013.notes:
Multifactor productivity is calculated by dividing an index of real output by an index of combined units of labor input and capital services. It is designed to measure the joint influences of technological change, efficiency improvements, returns to scale, reallocation of resources, and other factors of economic growth, accounting for the effects of capital and labor. The real value is the added output divided by combined inputs. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900013

MPU4900022.title: Private Business Sector: Value-Added Output
MPU4900022.notes:
Private business sector output is a chain-type, current-weighted index constructed after excluding from gross domestic product (GDP) the following outputs: general government, nonprofit institutions, private households (including owner-occupied housing), and government enterprises. This data used Tornqvist (cost share wts.) aggregate K and L. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900022

MPU4900023.title: Private Business Sector: Value-Added Output
MPU4900023.notes:
Private business sector output is a chain-type, current-weighted index constructed after excluding from gross domestic product (GDP) the following outputs: general government, nonprofit institutions, private households (including owner-occupied housing), and government enterprises. This data used Tornqvist (cost share wts.) aggregate K and L. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900023

MPU4900032.title: Private Business Sector: Combined Inputs
MPU4900032.notes:
Labor input and capital services are combined using chained superlative Tornqvist aggregation, applying weights that represent each component's share of total costs. The chained superlative Tornqvist index uses changing weights; the share in each year is averaged with the preceding year's share. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900032

MPU4900033.title: Private Business Sector: Combined Inputs
MPU4900033.notes:
Labor input and capital services are combined using chained superlative Tornqvist aggregation, applying weights that represent each component's share of total costs. The chained superlative Tornqvist index uses changing weights; the share in each year is averaged with the preceding year's share. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900033

MPU4900042.title: Private Business Sector: Capital Services
MPU4900042.notes:
Capital services are the services derived from the stock of physical assets and intellectual property assets. This data used Tornqvist aggregate K inputs. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900042

MPU4900043.title: Private Business Sector: Capital Services
MPU4900043.notes:
Capital services are the services derived from the stock of physical assets and intellectual property assets. This data used Tornqvist aggregate K inputs. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900043

MPU4900052.title: Private Business Sector: Labor Input
MPU4900052.notes:
Labor input in private business and private nonfarm business is obtained by chained superlative Tornqvist aggregation of the hours at work by all persons, classified by age, education, and gender with weights determined by each group's share of the total wage. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900052

MPU4900053.title: Private Business Sector: Labor Input
MPU4900053.notes:
Labor input in private business and private nonfarm business is obtained by chained superlative Tornqvist aggregation of the hours at work by all persons, classified by age, education, and gender with weights determined by each group's share of the total wage. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900053

MPU4900062.title: Private Business Sector: Labor Productivity
MPU4900062.notes:
The efficiency at which labor hours are utilized in producing output of goods and services, measured as output per hour of labor. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900062

MPU4900063.title: Private Business Sector: Labor Productivity
MPU4900063.notes:
The efficiency at which labor hours are utilized in producing output of goods and services, measured as output per hour of labor. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900063

MPU4900072.title: Private Business Sector: Output per Unit Capital Services
MPU4900072.notes:
Capital services are the services derived from the stock of physical assets and intellectual property assets. This data used Tornqvist aggregate K inputs. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900072

MPU4900073.title: Private Business Sector: Output per Unit Capital Services
MPU4900073.notes:
Capital services are the services derived from the stock of physical assets and intellectual property assets. This data used Tornqvist aggregate K inputs. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900073

MPU4900082.title: Private Business Sector: Capital Intensity
MPU4900082.notes:
Capital intensity is the ratio of capital services to hours worked in the production process. The higher the capital to hours ratio, the more capital intensive the production process is. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900082

MPU4900083.title: Private Business Sector: Capital Intensity
MPU4900083.notes:
Capital intensity is the ratio of capital services to hours worked in the production process. The higher the capital to hours ratio, the more capital intensive the production process is. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900083

MPU4900092.title: Private Business Sector: Labor Composition
MPU4900092.notes:
Labor composition was found by taking the ratio of labor input to hours. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900092

MPU4900093.title: Private Business Sector: Labor Composition
MPU4900093.notes:
Labor composition was found by taking the ratio of labor input to hours. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900093

MPU4900101.title: Private Business Sector: Current Dollar Output
MPU4900101.notes:
For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900101

MPU4900111.title: Private Business Sector: Capital Cost
MPU4900111.notes:
The cost to produce output of goods and services that is attributed to the use of capital, also known as capital costs. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900111

MPU4900121.title: Private Business Sector: Labor Compensation
MPU4900121.notes:
Monetary and non-monetary payments to or on behalf of individuals for labor services used to produce output. Compensation may include salaries, wages, bonuses, contributions to benefits plans, and other forms of payment. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900121

MPU4900131.title: Private Business Sector: Capital's Share in Cost
MPU4900131.notes:
The portion of the total costs to produce output that can be attributed to capital services. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900131

MPU4900141.title: Private Business Sector: Labor's Share in Cost
MPU4900141.notes:
The portion of the total costs to produce output that can be attributed to the cost of labor. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900141

MPU4900152.title: Private Business Sector: Contribution of Capital Intensity
MPU4900152.notes:
Capital intensity is the ratio of capital services to hours worked in the production process. The higher the capital to hours ratio, the more capital intensive the production process is. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900152

MPU4900153.title: Private Business Sector: Contribution of Capital Intensity
MPU4900153.notes:
Capital intensity is the ratio of capital services to hours worked in the production process. The higher the capital to hours ratio, the more capital intensive the production process is. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900153

MPU4900162.title: Private Business Sector: Contribution of Information Processing Equipment (IPE) Intensity
MPU4900162.notes:
Contribution of information capital intensity is the portion of labor productivity growth attributed to information or data that has intrinsic value which can be shared and leveraged within and between organizations. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900162

MPU4900163.title: Private Business Sector: Contribution of Information Processing Equipment (IPE) Intensity
MPU4900163.notes:
Contribution of information capital intensity is the portion of labor productivity growth attributed to information or data that has intrinsic value which can be shared and leveraged within and between organizations. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900163

MPU4900172.title: Private Business Sector: Contribution of Capital Services Excluding IPP and IPE Intensity
MPU4900172.notes:
The portion of labor productivity change attributed to capital services. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900172

MPU4900173.title: Private Business Sector: Contribution of Capital Services Excluding IPP and IPE Intensity
MPU4900173.notes:
The portion of labor productivity change attributed to capital services. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900173

MPU4900182.title: Private Business Sector: Contribution of Labor Composition
MPU4900182.notes:
The portion of labor productivity change attributed to the composition of the labor force. Labor composition is the monetary and non-monetary payments to or on behalf of individuals for labor services used to produce output. Compensation may include salaries, wages, bonuses, contributions to benefits plans, and other forms of payment. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900182

MPU4900183.title: Private Business Sector: Contribution of Labor Composition
MPU4900183.notes:
The portion of labor productivity change attributed to the composition of the labor force. Labor composition is the monetary and non-monetary payments to or on behalf of individuals for labor services used to produce output. Compensation may include salaries, wages, bonuses, contributions to benefits plans, and other forms of payment. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900183

MPU4900192.title: Private Business Sector: Contribution of Research and Development (R&D) Intensity
MPU4900192.notes:
The portion of labor productivity change attributed to research and development. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900192

MPU4900193.title: Private Business Sector: Contribution of Research and Development (R&D) Intensity
MPU4900193.notes:
The portion of labor productivity change attributed to research and development. 

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900193

MPU4900202.title: Private Business Sector: Contribution of Intellectual Property Products Excluding R&D Intensity
MPU4900202.notes:
For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/mfp/

 Source Indicator: MPU4900202

OPHPBS.title: Business Sector: Labor Productivity (Output per Hour) for All Employed Persons
OPHPBS.notes: The Productivity and Costs release on August 7, 2003, will reflect the June 2003 benchmark revision to payroll employment. Since employment is now reported on a North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) basis, all of the historical data will be revised. Changes as a consequence of the move to NAICS should not be significant since this release carries data at high levels of aggregation.

OUTBS.title: Business Sector: Output for All Employed Persons

PRS84006011.title: Business Sector: Employment for All Employed Persons
PRS84006011.units: Percent Change from Quarter One Year Ago
PRS84006011.notes:
For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006011

PRS84006012.title: Business Sector: Employment for All Employed Persons
PRS84006012.notes:

PRS84006013.title: Business Sector: Employment for All Employed Persons

PRS84006021.title: Business Sector: Average Weekly Hours Worked for All Employed Persons
PRS84006021.units: Percent Change from Quarter One Year Ago
PRS84006021.notes:
Hours data for the labor productivity and cost measures include hours worked for all persons working in the sector-wage and salary workers, the self-employed and unpaid family workers.

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006021

PRS84006022.title: Business Sector: Average Weekly Hours Worked for All Employed Persons
PRS84006022.notes:
Hours data for the labor productivity and cost measures include hours worked for all persons working in the sector-wage and salary workers, the self-employed and unpaid family workers.

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006022

PRS84006023.title: Business Sector: Average Weekly Hours Worked for All Employed Persons

PRS84006031.title: Business Sector: Hours Worked for All Employed Persons
PRS84006031.units: Percent Change from Quarter One Year Ago
PRS84006031.notes:
Hours data for the labor productivity and cost measures include hours worked for all persons working in the sector-wage and salary workers, the self-employed and unpaid family workers.

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006031

PRS84006032.title: Business Sector: Hours Worked for All Employed Persons
PRS84006032.notes:
Hours data for the labor productivity and cost measures include hours worked for all persons working in the sector-wage and salary workers, the self-employed and unpaid family workers.

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006032

PRS84006041.title: Business Sector: Output for All Employed Persons
PRS84006041.units: Percent Change from Quarter One Year Ago
PRS84006041.notes:
Real business sector output is an annual-weighted (Fisher-Ideal) index. It is constructed from the gross domestic product (GDP) excluding the following outputs: general government, nonprofit institutions, paid employees of private households, and the rental value of owner-occupied dwellings.

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006041

PRS84006042.title: Business Sector: Output for All Employed Persons
PRS84006042.notes:
Real business sector output is an annual-weighted (Fisher-Ideal) index. It is constructed from the gross domestic product (GDP) excluding the following outputs: general government, nonprofit institutions, paid employees of private households, and the rental value of owner-occupied dwellings.

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006042

PRS84006051.title: Business Sector: Current Dollar Output for All Employed Persons
PRS84006051.units: Percent Change from Quarter One Year Ago
PRS84006051.notes:
Business sector output is a chain-type, current-weighted index constructed after excluding from gross domestic product (GDP) the following outputs: general government, nonprofit institutions, and private households (including owner-occupied housing).

For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006051

PRS84006052.title: Business Sector: Current Dollar Output for All Employed Persons
PRS84006052.notes:
Business sector output is a chain-type, current-weighted index constructed after excluding from gross domestic product (GDP) the following outputs: general government, nonprofit institutions, and private households (including owner-occupied housing).

For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006052

PRS84006053.title: Business Sector: Current Dollar Output for All Employed Persons

PRS84006061.title: Business Sector: Compensation for All Employed Persons
PRS84006061.units: Percent Change from Quarter One Year Ago
PRS84006061.notes:
Labor Compensation includes accrued wages and salaries, supplements, employer contributions to employee benefit plans, and taxes.

For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006061

PRS84006062.title: Business Sector: Compensation for All Employed Persons
PRS84006062.notes:
Labor Compensation includes accrued wages and salaries, supplements, employer contributions to employee benefit plans, and taxes.

For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006062

PRS84006063.title: Business Sector: Compensation for All Employed Persons

PRS84006081.title: Business Sector: Nonlabor Payments for All Employed Persons
PRS84006081.units: Percent Change from Quarter One Year Ago
PRS84006081.notes:
Nonlabor payments are the excess of current-dollar output in an economic sector over corresponding labor compensation, and include nonlabor costs as well as corporate profits and the profit-type income of proprietors.

For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006081

PRS84006082.title: Business Sector: Nonlabor Payments for All Employed Persons
PRS84006082.notes:
Nonlabor payments are the excess of current-dollar output in an economic sector over corresponding labor compensation, and include nonlabor costs as well as corporate profits and the profit-type income of proprietors.

For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006082

PRS84006083.title: Business Sector: Nonlabor Payments for All Employed Persons

PRS84006091.title: Business Sector: Labor Productivity (Output per Hour) for All Employed Persons
PRS84006091.units: Percent Change from Quarter One Year Ago
PRS84006091.notes:
Labor productivity, or output per hour, is calculated by dividing an index of real output by an index of hours worked of all persons, including employees, proprietors, and unpaid family workers.

For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006091

PRS84006092.title: Business Sector: Labor Productivity (Output per Hour) for All Employed Persons
PRS84006092.notes:
Labor productivity, or output per hour, is calculated by dividing an index of real output by an index of hours worked of all persons, including employees, proprietors, and unpaid family workers.

For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006092

PRS84006101.title: Business Sector: Hourly Compensation for All Employed Persons
PRS84006101.units: Percent Change from Quarter One Year Ago
PRS84006101.notes:
Indexes of compensation per hour for major sectors measure the compensation of employees and the self-employed divided by hours worked by all persons engaged in the sector. Hours of all persons include hours worked by employees, proprietors, and unpaid family workers.

For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006101

PRS84006102.title: Business Sector: Hourly Compensation for All Employed Persons
PRS84006102.notes:
Indexes of compensation per hour for major sectors measure the compensation of employees and the self-employed divided by hours worked by all persons engaged in the sector. Hours of all persons include hours worked by employees, proprietors, and unpaid family workers.

For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006102

PRS84006111.title: Business Sector: Unit Labor Costs for All Employed Persons
PRS84006111.units: Percent Change from Quarter One Year Ago
PRS84006111.notes:
BLS calculates unit labor costs as the ratio of hourly compensation to labor productivity.

For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006111

PRS84006112.title: Business Sector: Unit Labor Costs for All Employed Persons
PRS84006112.notes:
BLS calculates unit labor costs as the ratio of hourly compensation to labor productivity.

For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006112

PRS84006131.title: Business Sector: Unit Nonlabor Payments for All Employed Persons
PRS84006131.units: Percent Change from Quarter One Year Ago
PRS84006131.notes:
Unit nonlabor payments (UNLP) include the nonlabor components of gross product originating in a given sector-consumption of fixed capital, taxes on production and imports less subsidies, net interest and miscellaneous payments, business current transfer payments, rental income of persons, and the current surplus of government enterprises as well as profits-whereas unit nonlabor costs (UNLC) exclude profits.

For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006131

PRS84006132.title: Business Sector: Unit Nonlabor Payments for All Employed Persons
PRS84006132.notes:
Unit nonlabor payments (UNLP) include the nonlabor components of gross product originating in a given sector-consumption of fixed capital, taxes on production and imports less subsidies, net interest and miscellaneous payments, business current transfer payments, rental income of persons, and the current surplus of government enterprises as well as profits-whereas unit nonlabor costs (UNLC) exclude profits.

For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006132

PRS84006141.title: Business Sector: Implicit Price Deflator for All Employed Persons
PRS84006141.units: Percent Change from Quarter One Year Ago
PRS84006141.notes:
Implicit Price Deflator is the current dollar output divided by the output index.

For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006141

PRS84006142.title: Business Sector: Implicit Price Deflator for All Employed Persons
PRS84006142.notes:
Implicit Price Deflator is the current dollar output divided by the output index.

For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006142

PRS84006151.title: Business Sector: Real Hourly Compensation for All Employed Persons
PRS84006151.units: Percent Change from Quarter One Year Ago
PRS84006151.notes:
Indexes of compensation per hour for major sectors measure the compensation of employees and the self-employed divided by hours worked by all persons engaged in the sector. Real compensation per hour reflect the adjustment of hourly compensation for changes in consumer prices.

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006151

PRS84006152.title: Business Sector: Real Hourly Compensation for All Employed Persons
PRS84006152.notes:
Indexes of compensation per hour for major sectors measure the compensation of employees and the self-employed divided by hours worked by all persons engaged in the sector. Real compensation per hour reflect the adjustment of hourly compensation for changes in consumer prices.

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006152

PRS84006161.title: Business Sector: Output per Job for All Employed Persons
PRS84006161.units: Percent Change from Quarter One Year Ago
PRS84006161.notes:
Real business sector output is an annual-weighted (Fisher-Ideal) index. It is constructed from the gross domestic product (GDP) excluding the following outputs: general government, nonprofit institutions, paid employees of private households, and the rental value of owner-occupied dwellings.

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006161

PRS84006162.title: Business Sector: Output per Job for All Employed Persons
PRS84006162.notes:
Real business sector output is an annual-weighted (Fisher-Ideal) index. It is constructed from the gross domestic product (GDP) excluding the following outputs: general government, nonprofit institutions, paid employees of private households, and the rental value of owner-occupied dwellings.

 For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006162

PRS84006163.title: Business Sector: Output per Job for All Employed Persons

PRS84006171.title: Business Sector: Labor Share for All Employed Persons
PRS84006171.units: Percent Change from Quarter One Year Ago
PRS84006171.notes:
Labor's share in current dollar output in a given sector is simply the ratio of labor compensation paid in that sector to current dollar output.

For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006171

PRS84006172.title: Business Sector: Labor Share for All Employed Persons
PRS84006172.notes:
Labor's share in current dollar output in a given sector is simply the ratio of labor compensation paid in that sector to current dollar output.

For more information, please go to https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/prod2.pdf

Source Indicator PRS84006172
